page.title: 05River Exe through Tiverton
page.content: The River Exe runs right through Tiverton and splits the town into two parts. Just to the south of the town it is joined by the River Lowman which is much smaller. It is because these two rivers could be crossed at this point that our town is called Tiverton, from the Saxon "Twyfordton", meaning Two-Fords-Town. To the west of the River Exe is the Heathcoat Textile Factory. The river used to provide the power for the factory machines by a leat (canal) which was made to run through it. In 1960 there was a terrible flood in the town and this caused so much damage that new (and rather ugly) concrete flood barriers have been put up along the riverbanks in the town. The river is good for fishing (trout, salmon eels etc) and canoeing. A Raft Race is held every year for charity.
